name: The Tippin' Point Online Trivia | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"You've got to be your own man not a puppet on a string".

In the chorus of this song, this line appears shortly after the title of the song is sung.  It was Aaron Tippin's first single.  What is the title of the song, as well as the album it comes from?
questions.correct: You've Got to Stand for Something
questions.explanation:
You've Got to Stand for Something.

	"You've Got to Stand for Something" was released in late 1990 as Aaron Tippin's debut single.  It was found on the album "You've Got to Stand for Something", which was released in early 1991.  The song reached 6th in the US and 13th in Canada All the incorrect answer options were phrases that are also found within the chorus of the song.

questions.text:
"Sometimes she runs, sometimes she don't".

This is the first line of a song by Aaron Tippin that was also remade with Alvin and the Chipmunks later that same year.  What song is it?
questions.correct: There Ain't Nothin' Wrong With the Radio
options: There Ain't Anything Wrong With the Radio
There Isn't Anything Wrong With the Radio
There Isn't Nothin' Wrong With the Radio
questions.explanation:
There Ain't Nothin' Wrong With the Radio.

	"There Ain't Nothin' Wrong With the Radio" was released in 1992, and was found on the album "Read Between the Lines".  Tippin sang the song later that year with Alvin and the Chipmunks on the album "Chipmunks in Low Places".  In the song, Simon kept criticizing Aaron about all the grammatical errors within the song.  He would fix it to "sometimes she runs, sometimes she doesn't" and "there isn't anything wrong with the radio".  The song was very popular; and reached the top position in both the US and Canada.

questions.text:
"Tell her that heaven without her feels like hell tonight".

Aaron Tippin sang a song about his angel, but do you know what color angel he sang about?
questions.explanation:
My Blue Angel.

	"My Blue Angel" was released in 1993 as a single.  It was from his "Read Between the Lines" album, which was released in 1992.  "My Blue Angel" reached seventh on the US Country charts, and 16th in Canada.

questions.text:
"If you wanna cram course in reality".

This is sung a few times throughout the song, just before the title.  What Aaron Tippin song is it?
questions.explanation:
Workin' Man's Ph.D.

	"Workin' Man's Ph.D." was released in 1993 on his album "Call of the Wild".  With a peak position of seven in the US and six in Canada, it was his most successful single from the album.

questions.text:
"It ain't nothin' but a small frame house on an acre lot".

Throughout the song, Aaron Tippin sings about a lot of his belongings, and how he earned them, buying them with his own cash.  What song is this?
options: I Bought It From Some Shady Guy Down at the County Fair
questions.explanation:
I Got It Honest.

	"I Got It Honest" was released in 1994.  It was found on the album "Lookin' Back at Myself", which was also released in 1994.  It peaked at 15 in the US and nine in Canada.

questions.text:
"I can dream, I can hope, I can scheme, but still I know..."

Still know what?
questions.correct: That's As Close As I'll Get to Loving You
options: I'll Never Be Able to Call You My Baby
questions.explanation:
That's As Close As I'll Get to Loving You.

	"That's As Close As I'll Get to Loving You" was released as a single in 1995.  It was from Aaron Tippin's 1995 album "Tool Box".  It reached tenth in Canada charts and number one in the US (country charts; he reached 101 on Billboards Hot 100).

questions.text:
"To fall in head over heels, but girl..."

What follows this verse, and is the title of another Aaron Tippin single?
options: I'm Just a Little Bit Crazy Tonight
questions.explanation:
For You I Will.

	"For You I Will" was released in 1998, and was found on the album "What This Country Needs", which was released in the same year.  The song reached number six on US charts, and 27 in Canada.

questions.text: Aaron Tippin sang a song called "This Kiss".
questions.explanation:
False.

	Aaron Tippin does not sing a song called "This Kiss", but rather, he sings "Kiss This".  "This Kiss" is a Faith Hill song.  "Kiss This" was released as a single in 2000, and can be found on Tippin's album "People Like Us".  The song reached the top position in the US and third in Canada.

questions.text:
"There's a lady that stands in a harbor for what we believe".

Aaron Tippin, like many other artists, released a song about the country just days after 9/11.  What was the song?
questions.correct: Where the Stars and Stripes and the Eagle Fly
options: Courtesy of the Red, White, and Blue (The Angry American)
Where Were You (When the World Stopped Turning)
questions.explanation:
Where the Stars and Stripes and the Eagle Fly.

	Dozens of songs about 9/11 were released shortly after the attack.  For Aaron Tippin, he began recording the song two days after the incident, and released it on September 17, 2001, just six days after the towers fell.  The song "Where the Stars and Stripes and the Eagle Fly" can be found on his "Stars and Stripes" album, released in 2001.  The song reached number two on the US charts (and it had tough competition with countless other "9/11 songs"). "Where Were You (When the World Stopped Turning)" was released by Alan Jackson, "Have You Forgotten?" was released by Darryl Worley, and "Courtesy of the Red, White, and Blue (The Angry American)" was released by Toby Keith. For a much larger list of all the songs released that were about 9/11, or in response to the event, please check out this link. http://en.wikipedia.org

questions.text:
"The boys are thirsty in Atlanta and there's beer in Texarkana".

Aaron Tippin released this song in 2009, but where would the song take you?
questions.explanation:
East Bound and Down.

	"East Bound and Down" was released in 2009, and can be found on Aaron Tippin's album "In Overdrive".  The song did not chart for him, however.  It did chart to number two in both the US and Canada in 1977, however, for Jerry Reed, who first performed the song.
